Summary:
The server at https://███ is running a vulnerable version of CSA.
A code injection vulnerability in the Ivanti EPM Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) allows an unauthenticated user to execute arbitrary code with limited permissions (nobody).

Use Burp Repeater to send the following GET requests:
Please note that for the system commands to run, they need to be Base64 encoded. For example, for phpinfo, pass cGhwaW5mbygpOw==

steps: Identify the vulnerable server running Ivanti EPM Cloud Services Appliance (CSA).
Use Burp Repeater to send a GET request to the vulnerable endpoint with a Base64 encoded system command (e.g., 'cGhwaW5mbygpOw==' for phpinfo).
vuln_description: A code injection vulnerability in the Ivanti EPM Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) allows an unauthenticated user to execute arbitrary code with limited permissions (nobody).
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward injection of Base64 encoded commands via a GET request, without requiring complex interactions or state manipulation.

authnz_metadata.reason: The vulnerability involves an unauthenticated user executing arbitrary code on a server running a vulnerable version of Ivanti EPM Cloud Services Appliance (CSA). The proposed methodologies focus on AuthN/AuthZ bypasses and IDOR within the same application context by swapping user sessions or resource IDs. However, this vulnerability is a remote code execution (RCE) flaw that doesn't involve session or resource ID manipulation within the same application context, making it outside the scope of the described methodologies.
